about.summary: The package provides functions to deal with binary classification problems in the presence of imbalanced classes. Synthetic balanced samples are generated according to ROSE (Menardi and Torelli, 2013). Functions that implement more traditional remedies to the class imbalance are also provided, as well as different metrics to evaluate a learner accuracy. These are estimated by holdout, bootstrap or cross-validation methods.

The package provides functions to deal with binary classification problems in the presence of imbalanced classes. Synthetic balanced samples are generated according to ROSE (Menardi and Torelli, 2013). Functions that implement more traditional remedies to the class imbalance are also provided, as well as different metrics to evaluate a learner accuracy. These are estimated by holdout, bootstrap or cross-validation methods.

name: r-rose

about.summary: The package provides functions to deal with binary classification problems in the presence of imbalanced classes. Synthetic balanced samples are generated according to ROSE (Menardi and Torelli, 2013). Functions that implement more traditional remedies to the class imbalance are also provided, as well as different metrics to evaluate a learner accuracy. These are estimated by holdout, bootstrap or cross-validation methods.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.0-3' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-rose
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/ROSE_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/ROSE/ROSE_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 625e598a016d4c52c7c26e0d520b6977bfe2b745bedb45d7014abd3c607e6989

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('ROSE')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('ROSE')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=ROSE
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: The package provides functions to deal with binary classification problems in the
    presence of imbalanced classes. Synthetic balanced samples are generated according
    to ROSE (Menardi and Torelli, 2013). Functions that implement more traditional remedies
    to the class imbalance are also provided, as well as different metrics to evaluate
    a learner accuracy. These are estimated by holdout, bootstrap or cross-validation
    methods.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: ROSE
# Type: Package
# Title: ROSE: Random Over-Sampling Examples
# Version: 0.0-3
# Date: 2014-01-30
# Author: Nicola Lunardon, Giovanna Menardi, Nicola Torelli
# Maintainer: Nicola Lunardon <lunardon@stat.unipd.it>
# Suggests: MASS, nnet, rpart, tree
# Description: The package provides functions to deal with binary classification problems in the presence of imbalanced classes. Synthetic balanced samples are generated according to ROSE (Menardi and Torelli, 2013). Functions that implement more traditional remedies to the class imbalance are also provided, as well as different metrics to evaluate a learner accuracy. These are estimated by holdout, bootstrap or cross-validation methods.
# License: GPL-2
# Packaged: 2014-07-15 09:19:18 UTC; nicola
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2014-07-15 18:41:03
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
